parts.text: Growing shelter belts.
Keeping milk at approximately 4 oC in a bulk tank.
Tagging young animals.
Spreading ground limestone.
Injecting bonhams (piglets) with an iron solution.
Explain the following terms used in genetics.

The pure‐breeding barley variety Alpha (AA) has a straw length of 800 mm. The pure‐breeding barley variety Beta (BB) has a straw length of 600 mm. A cross between these two varieties results in a hybrid with a straw length of 700 mm.

subparts.text: What does this show about the genes that control straw length in this example?

Copy and complete the following in your book to show the cross between the Alpha and Beta varieties of barley. Parents: Pure‐breeding Alpha X Pure‐breeding Beta Genotypes of parents: ( ) X ( ) Gametes: ( ) X ( ) Genotype of offspring: ( ) Phenotype of hybrid offspring: _____________________

The hybrid plants were allowed to self‐pollinate and the resulting seeds were sown. Copy and complete the following in your book, using the above hybrids as parents. Genotype of parents: ( ) X ( ) Gametes: ( ) ( ) X ( ) ( ) Genotypes of offspring: ( ) ( ) ( ) Phenotypes of offspring: ________________ _________________ _________________

parts.text: (i) State one advantage of using artificial insemination (AI) on a dairy farm. (ii) State one disadvantage of using AI on a dairy farm.

parts.text:
(i) Explain how an iron pan is formed in a soil.
(ii) What are the effects of an iron pan in a soil?
(iii) Name the soil group in which an iron pan is most likely to form.
(iv) How can an iron pan in a soil be removed?
Describe the method of taking soil samples for testing.
Describe a method to measure the pH of a soil sample.
Name the feature labelled A.
State two functions of A.
What is the main function of the cells labelled B?
State two ways in which the structure of a leaf is suited to its main role.
Name the structures labelled X.
State two functions of X.
Name a plant that has a modified stem.
Describe an experiment to show phototropism in seedlings.

(i) What component of milk is represented by the part labelled A? (ii) What is colostrum? (iii) Give two ways a farmer could improve the quality of the milk from his herd. (iv) Why is the milk from a cow treated for mastitis not allowed into the human food supply? (v) Give one reasons for culling cows on a dairy farm. (vi) What is meant by the term dual purpose breed? (vii) Give one example of a dual purpose breed.

(i) What is meant by the term pollution? (ii) In each of the following state two ways that a farmer can reduce the risk of causing pollution: 1. When making silage 2. On a dairy farm 3. When spreading artificial fertiliser 4. When using insecticides or fungicides.
